bullets.text: ADP: November private payrolls fell 32,000, driven by sharp small-business cuts, signaling cooling labor demand.
Stocks closed near record highs as investors embraced weak hiring as disinflationary, supporting lower-rate expectations.
Trump moves to slash fuel-efficiency standards; analysts say rule changes won’t quickly lower car prices or pump demand.
Energy Department awards $800 million to small modular reactor projects, bolstering nuclear’s role in meeting surging power demand.
Nvidia’s CEO discussed chip export controls with Trump, criticized patchwork state AI rules, signaling push for national, coherent AI policy.
Anthropic hires IPO counsel, preparing one of the largest tech offerings, signaling robust investor appetite for AI leaders.
Microsoft shares fell on reports AI product sales missed internal targets, underscoring monetization challenges despite heavy investment.
Salesforce beat earnings and raised guidance, citing a powerful revenue pipeline, buoying large-cap software sentiment.
AI’s voracious power needs are creating winners in utilities and grid equipment, though consumers risk higher bills if the boom reverses.
Trump’s South Korea tariff cuts materially benefit Hyundai and GM, reshaping auto supply chains and pricing dynamics.
Putin warned Europe of war as Ukraine talks falter; EU races to secure long-term Ukraine financing from frozen Russian assets.
Bitcoin has lagged lofty price predictions, highlighting persistent crypto volatility and fragile retail enthusiasm.
JWST found a Milky Way–like galaxy in the early universe, challenging timelines for rapid disk galaxy formation.
Shingles vaccination correlated with substantially lower dementia risk, suggesting broad public-health and cost-saving implications.
Researchers identified the first gene directly causing mental illness, opening avenues for precise diagnostics and targeted therapies.
